channel.title: Researches on Joshua Russell
channel.description: Recent content in Researches on Joshua Russell

item.title: NoMelt: high-resolution constraints on oceanic lithosphere anisotropy
item.description: Seismic anisotropy offers perhaps the most direct window into convection in Earth's mantle as well as the structure and formation of oceanic plates. The NoMelt experiment, located ~1000 km southeast of Hawaii, was designed to better understand the fundamental plate tectonic processes involved in the formation and evolution of oceanic plates by looking at a region far from complications due to upwelling or subduction. I use surface waves recorded on ocean bottom seismometers (OBS) at NoMelt to measure seismic anisotropy (both azimuthal and polarization, or radial, anisotropy) in detail.

item.title: OBSrange: A new tool for the precise location of ocean bottom seismometers
